column4: Where should I ask a question on iptables. I got something that worked on Lucid but doesn't on Precise
hmm, sounds like this is the place to ask then, though I haven't got an answer for that :P
that shouldn't be necessary, a clean install of grub2 though is probably easier than fixing one that's not working
that's what we're talking about, clean install
I meant just a clean install of Grub2, not the entire OS
i don't know how much the machine is messed up, i wouldn't take chances, that's all
apparently not, sorry, I could use one myself.  My iptables configs have a tendency to revert on their own...
the entire configuration seems to change back to some default one.
are you using a particular firewall? did you check the logs?
if something is messing with iptables, there's bound to be something in the logs

I checked the logs, they don't show anything about it, and I'm not running any of the firewall programs (i.e. ufw).  I've been through those possibilities -_-, so I've pretty much just given up on it, barring some special revelation that people maybe wanted me to figure out from the man pages...
so you got your own iptables rules, right?
and when you do sudo iptables -L, they're gone after a while?
yeah, I've saved them, so I just need to run the restore when they rever, so it's just obnoxious, but not debilitating for me
yeah, they disappear after a while, it's hard to debug though, because that while varies from a few minutes to a few weeks.
hmm, I might try ex0a's suggestion for you :P  I just haven't been able to detect anything changing it, so I was thinking it was something changing it internal to iptables.
